instructions:
CUSTOMER SERVICE INTERACTION TEST

You are about to start the "Customer Service Interaction" test. For this test, you will need to listen to information that is provided to you through the computer. We recommend using a headset or a set of quality speakers.

During this test you will play the role of a customer service agent who is responding to telephone calls for service. To do this you must first answer the call and enter the caller’s name and telephone number. When the "Incoming Call" button begins flashing and you hear the telephone ringing, click on the button to answer the call. After the customer provides you with their name and telephone number and you have entered that information in the appropriate fields, click the "Run Search" button.

Once you have brought up the customer information and at various points throughout the test, you will be presented with three different ways you, as the customer service agent, might respond to the caller. At those times, you will be asked to select the "Most effective" and "Least effective" response of the three choices. Each choice will be presented in a written format and will also have an audio version for you to listen to. You can listen to the response by clicking on the "Play Audio" button next to each response.

The "Most effective" response is the one which, in general, is most likely to create a good impression of the customer service agent to the caller in terms of communication, politeness, interpersonal interaction, demonstrating sound judgment, and effectively addressing the caller’s issues.

The "Least effective" response one which, in general, is most likely to create a poor impression of the customer service agent to the caller.

If there appears to be more than one most effective or least effective response, then please do your best to choose between them to indicate the very most effective or very least effective response.

Please choose one "Most effective" response and one "Least effective" response by clicking on the appropriate radio buttons.

Finally, at any time during this test you may click on the "Repeat caller’s last statement" button if you wish to hear the caller’s last comment again.

Good luck!

questions.notes:
Name: Mayerson, Cindy
Prefix: Mrs.
Address: 4627 Arlon Place
Telephone: 786-427-8911
History: Purchased Gold Service
Payment History: Credit card finance charge debited and then credited.
Credit card expiration date: 5/2009

responces.responceText: Thank you. I'm just pulling up your account information now. There it is; now, what can I do for you?
Give me a minute. Okay, now how can I help you?
Okay, I've brought it up on my screen. Now, how may I assist you today?
Why do you want to cancel?
I'm sorry to hear that. Would you mind giving us feedback as to why you want to cancel?
I'm so sorry to hear that you are upset with our company. Is there any way we can improve our service?
Mrs. Mayerson, I understand why you're so upset. I would be upset, too, if I had monthly service problems; That's why I'm going to resolve this for you right away.
Mrs. Mayerson, please tell me specifically what the service problems are, I can begin to resolve them for you.
Mrs. Mayerson, you've got two choices: either you settle down now or call back when you have.
Yes, you were rude, but I understand your frustration.
It's okay to be upset, but being upset doesn't solve anything.
I understand how you feel. That would be upsetting to me also.
I see the credit. I guess we must have messed up.
Yes, according to our records a charge was deleted and a credit was issued.
Yes, I see a correction was made to your account.
You are absolutely right; you shouldn't be accruing any finance charges for full payment. Let's verify your credit card information; please tell me the expiration date.
Of course not. We would never do that. Let's just check your credit card information. I'll just need your credit card expiration date.
We would never do that. Maybe the mistake is on your end. Please give me your credit card expiration date so I can check.
I didn't understand a word you said. If you want me to help you, you will have to repeat it.
I'm sorry. Would you mind repeating that slowly for me?
Would you mind repeating that?
I'm sorry. But the date you told me is not correct.
We have a different expiration date on record. Are you sure of that expiration date?
Are you sure you gave me the correct expiration date?
I wish you had told me that earlier. That would have saved us both some time. Anything else on your mind today?
It's okay, Ms. Mayerson. Have you got any other concerns I can help you with today?
That seems to have been what caused the finance charges. Anything else I can do for you today?
Okay, have a good day. Goodbye.
Okay, if that's it, it's time for me to go. Call back if you have further questions. Have a good day.
I'm glad I could help you today. If you have any more questions, please feel free to call back. Good bye.

Let's get back to your concern.

I guess we could ship you a new replacement part.
You'll get the part when your post office finally delivers it.
You should be receiving it in five to seven business days, most likely.
Ma'am, it should be delivered to your doorstep soon.
You're welcome; is there anything else I can assist you with?
You're welcome; is there anything else you need?
You're welcome; so that's it, right? Nothing else?
